item.title: LLM + copyright
item.description: Arxiv Papers: LLM meets Copyright # 2024-03-15 Lost in Overlap: Exploring Watermark Collision in LLMs Yiyang Luo, Ke Lin, Chao Gu abstract abstract: The proliferation of large language models (LLMs) in generating contentraises concerns about text copyright. Watermarking methods, particularlylogit-based approaches, embed imperceptible identifiers into text to addressthese challenges. However, the widespread use of watermarking across diverseLLMs has led to an inevitable issue known as watermark collision during commontasks like question answering and paraphrasing.
